2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 3 ^ Non avèrtas fáçiem tuam a me. In qŭacùmqŭe die trìbulor
et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: inclína ad me aŭrem tuam~; in qŭacùmqŭe die invocávero te
O Lord: velóciter exáŭdi me. ^ Turn not away thy face from me. In the day when I am in trouble
my prayer: incline thy ear to me; in what day soever I shall call upon thee

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 4 ^ Qŭia defecérunt sicut fumus dies mei
et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et òssua mea sicut crèmium aruérunt. ^ For my days are vanished like smoke
O Lord: and my bones are grown dry like fuel for the fire.

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et áruit cor meum
O Lord: qŭia oblítus sum comèdere panem meum. ^ I am smitten as grass
because I forgot to eat my bread.

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 6 ^ A voce ģèmitûs mei adháĕsit òssu meum carni meaĕ. ^ Through the voice of my groaning
et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: my bone hath cleaved to my flesh.

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 7 ^ Sìmilis factus sum pelicáno solitúdinis~; factus sum sicut noctìcorax in domicìlio. ^ I am become like to a pelican of the wilderness; I am like a night raven in the house.

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et factus sum sicut passer solitárius in tecto. ^ I have watched
O Lord: and am become as a sparrow all alone on the housetop.

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 9 ^ Tota die exprobrábant mìchi inimíci mei
et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et qŭi laŭdábant me advèrsum me jurábant~; ^ All the day long my enemies reproached me
O Lord: and they that praised me did swear against me.

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et potum meum cum flétu miscébam
O Lord: ^ For I did eat ashes like bread
my prayer: and mingled my drink with weeping

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 11 ^ a fáçie iraĕ et indignațiónis tuaĕ~; qŭia élevans allisìsti me. ^ because of thy anger and indignation~; for having lifted me up thou hast thrown me down.

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et ego sicut foĕnum árui. ^ My days have declined like a shadow
O Lord: and I am withered like grass.

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: Dòmine
my prayer: et memoriále tuum in ģenerațiónem et ģenerațiónem. ^ But thou
column7: and thy memorial to all generations.

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: qŭia tempus miserèndi ejus
O Lord: qŭia vênit tempus. ^ Thou shalt arise and have mercy on Sion
my prayer: for it is time to have mercy on it

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 15 ^ Qŭóniam placuérunt sèrvîs tuîs lápides ejus
et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et terraĕ ejus miserebùntur. ^ For the stones thereof have pleased thy servants
O Lord: and they shall have pity on the earth thereof.

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: Dòmine
O Lord: et òmnes reģes terraĕ glóriam tuam. ^ All the Gentiles shall fear thy name
and all the kings of the earth thy glory.

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et vedébitur in glória sua. ^ For the Lord hath built up Sion
O Lord: and he shall be seen in his glory.

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 18 ^ Respèxit in orațiónem humìlium et non sprevit prècem eórum. ^ He hath had regard to the prayer of the humble
et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: and he hath not despised their petition.
et pòpulus qŭi creábitur laŭdábit Dòminum. ^ Let these things be written unto another generation
O Lord: and the people that shall be created shall praise the Lord

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 20 ^ Qŭia prospèxit de excèlso sancto suo~; Dòminus de caĕlo in terram aspèxit
et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: ^ because he hath looked forth from his high sanctuary~; from heaven the Lord hath looked upon the earth

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 21 ^ ut aŭdíret ģèmitûs compeditórum~; ut sòlveret fílios interemptórum~; ^ that he might hear the groans of them that are in fetters~; that he might release the children of the slain~;
22 ^ ut adnúnțiet in Sióne nomen Dòmini
et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et laŭdem ejus in Jerusalíme. ^ that they may declare the name of the Lord in Sion
et reģes ut sèrviant Dòmino. ^ When the people assemble together

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 24 ^ Respòndit ei in via virtútis suaĕ
et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: «~Paŭcitátem diérum meórum núnția mìchi.~»^ He answered him in the way of his strength
O Lord: "Declare unto me the fewness of my days."

2 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam: 25 ^ Ne rèvoces me in dimìdio diérum meórum
et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: in ģenerațiónem et ģenerațiónem anni tui. ^ Call me not away in the midst of my days~; thy years are unto generation and generation.
Dòmine
my prayer: et ópera mánuum tuárum sunt caĕli. ^ In the beginning
column7: and the heavens are the works of thy hands.

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: tu aŭtem pèrmanes
et mutabùntur~; ^ They shall perish but thou remainest
column6: and all of them shall grow old like a garment
column7: and as a vesture thou shalt change them

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et anni tui non defìcient. ^ But thou art always the selfsame
O Lord: and thy years shall not fail.

et clamor meus ad te vèniat. ^ Hear: et semen eórum in sáĕculum diriģétur. ^ The children of thy servants shall continue and their seed shall be directed for ever.
